meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Sherri Cohen Aaron Ellis John Avila Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7448.

td.p: Sherri Cohen, a nonprofit writer and editor from Brooklyn, New York
Aaron Ellis, a high school physics teacher from Whitestown, Indiana
John Avila, an attorney from Arlington, Virginia (whose 2-day cash winnings total $38,201)

tr.td: AMERICAN AUTHORS
4-LETTER EDIBLES
CLASSIC DISNEY TITLE CHARACTERS
FOREIGN WORDS & PHRASES
IN THE FOOTSTEPS OF HISTORY
THE BIG 3-0

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: John
Aaron
Sherri

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Aaron] And we were going for a state capital. The city, not the state.)
...
(Alex: [To John] December 7, 1787. History made because Delaware became the first state to sign the U.S. Constitution. And the capital of Delaware is [*].)
SherriWhat is Massachuset
$501
AaronWhat is Albany New York?
$12,000
JohnWhat is Annapolis?
$12,401
Dover')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'On Dec. 7, 1787 30 delegates at Battell\'s Tavern gathered & made history in what\'s now this state capital')

tr.td: U.S. HISTORY
On Dec. 7, 1787 30 delegates at Battell's Tavern gathered & made history in what's now this state capital
John
Aaron
Sherri
3-day champion: $40,600
2nd place: $2,000
3rd place: $1,000
John
Aaron
Sherri

20 R
(including 1 DD),
4 W
(including 1 DD)

8 R,
5 W
(including 1 DD)
